block.p: Nicole Kristen Artzer, a daughter of Joyce and Richard Artzer of Fort Worth, Tex., was married there yesterday to John Samuel Weeldreyer, the son of Janet Cornwell of Philadelphia and Dennis Weeldreyer of Hickory, N.C. The Rev. Dr. Nicholas V. Gamvas performed the ceremony at St. Demetrios Greek Orthodox Church.

Mr. and Mrs. Weeldreyer work in Dallas, where the bride is an associate in the private wealth management group of Goldman, Sachs & Company, the investment bank. The bridegroom is an associate in the investment banking division of the Chase Manhattan Corporation. The couple received M.B.A. degrees from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, where they met.

Nicole Kristen Artzer, a daughter of Joyce and Richard Artzer of Fort Worth, Tex., was married there yesterday to John Samuel Weeldreyer, the son of Janet Cornwell of Philadelphia and Dennis Weeldreyer of Hickory, N.C. The Rev. Dr. Nicholas V. Gamvas performed the ceremony at St. Demetrios Greek Orthodox Church.

Mr. and Mrs. Weeldreyer work in Dallas, where the bride is an associate in the private wealth management group of Goldman, Sachs & Company, the investment bank. The bridegroom is an associate in the investment banking division of the Chase Manhattan Corporation. The couple received M.B.A. degrees from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, where they met.

The bride, 28, graduated from Dartmouth College. Her father is the chief executive officer of Decora Industries, the manufacturer of Con-Tact adhesive paper and other shelf-liner products in Fort Edward, N.Y.

The bridegroom, 27, graduated from Appalachian State University. His mother is the executive director of the Delaware Early Childhood Center, an early intervention program for infants and toddlers with disabilities in Harrington. His father is a warehouse employee at Merchant Distributors, a company that distributes wholesale foods in Hickory.
